intro: Paepalanthus jahnii, commonly known as the Jahn's cactus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cactaceae. It is native to Argentina and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent structure. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and birds, contributing to its ecological role. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
